business.headline: Indobell Insulation IPO Day 3: Check latest subscription status and GMPIndobell Insulation IPO: The Rs 10.14 crore initial public offering was fully subscribed on the first day itself and continues to attract bids as it enters its final day today, January 8.
Sensex, Nifty open lower amid weak sentiments; Reliance jumps 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 141.64 points to 78,057.47 at 10:09 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 42.60 points lower at 23,665.30.
HDFC Bank introduces revised lending and FD rates. Check detailsHDFC Bank lowers MCLR by up to 5 bps, revises FD rates, offering financial relief and flexibility for borrowers and depositors.
ITR filing: Submit these investment proofs to claim deductions and save on TDSSubmit proofs promptly to reduce TDS, maximise tax savings, and ensure smooth compliance before filing your ITR.

India's GDP growth may hit 4-year low of 6.4% in FY25, shows government dataThe slowdown in the government's first advance estimates highlights a more tempered pace of economic activity and indicates that the economy could grow at the slowest pace in four years.
Sensex, Nifty recover after Monday's slump; RIL gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex added 234.12 points to close at 78,199.11, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 91.85 points to end at 23,707.90.
Explained: Why Paras Defence share price surged 10% todayParas Defence and Space Technologies Ltd designs, develops, manufactures, and tests a range of products for the defence and space sectors.

Budget 2025: How new tax regime evolved over the years and what's next?As Budget 2025 nears, more changes to the new tax regime are expected to simplify taxes and benefit salaried employees and pensioners.
Junior employees at HCLTech to get up to 4% salary increase: ReportRecently, Infosys, a major competitor, announced 90% performance bonuses for the second quarter ending September.

Will Q3 results deepen Dalal Street sell-off? 3 stocks to watch amid uncertaintySensex and Nifty plunged over 1.5%, and the Nifty PSU Bank suffered a loss of close to 4% in Monday's bloodbath on Dalal Street. The Q3 earnings season is set to kick off with TCS announcing its results on January 9.

Explained: Why MobiKwik share price jumped nearly 12% despite reporting Q2 lossMobikwik stock price today: The sharp rally came despite the company reporting a consolidated net loss of Rs 3.59 crore in Q2 FY25, compared to a profit of Rs 5.23 crore in Q2 FY24.
SBI Har Ghar Lakhpati Scheme: Eligibility, features and interest rates explained SBI's Har Ghar Lakhpati RD helps individuals achieve Rs 1 lakh with small monthly investments and attractive returns.

Budget 2025: Will new income tax regime steal the spotlight again?Budget 2025 tax expectations: The upcoming budget may focus on the new income tax regime yet again to increase its appeal compared to the old tax regime.

ITR filing: Technical glitch keeps Section 87A rebate unavailable for taxpayersTaxpayers remain unable to claim the Section 87A rebate on STCG income due to outdated ITR processing logic, even after recent updates to filing forms by the Income Tax Department.

Is Zomato's dream stock market run over? Zomato's share price has declined over 9% in the past 5 trading sessions and over 14% in a month. At around 12:05 pm, shares of the company were trading 4.38% lower at Rs 253.05.

Delta Autocorp IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band and other detailsDelta Autocorp IPO open for bidding: The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 54.60 crore, comprising a fresh issue of 38.88 lakh shares amounting to Rs 50.54 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.12 lakh shares, aggregating to Rs 4.06 crore.

Budget 2025: Trade Unions join pre-budget discussions with Nirmala SitharamanBudget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held pre-Budget talks with trade unions to shape the Union Budget 2025-26, focusing on economic challenges and growth ahead of its February 1 presentation.

Stock market recovers after yesterday's crash. What's next on Dalal Street?Stock market recovery today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.11 points to 78,219.10 at 11:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 115.75 points to trade at 23,735.10.

Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Check GMP, price band, subscription Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares.
Explained: Why Biocon share price jumped over 7% todayBiocon stock price: At around 10:45 am, shares of the company were trading 7.22% higher at Rs 384.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Make Canada 51st state, retake Panama Canal: Trump's US expansion agendaWhile speaking to reporters on Tuesday at his Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida, Trump, who is scheduled to take office on January 20, also promised to rename the Gulf of Mexico to the "Gulf of America" and said he would demand far higher defence spending from Nato allies.

Body of 1 miner recovered from flooded coal mine in Assam, 8 still trappedMultiple agencies, including the Navy and the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF), continued operations on Wednesday to rescue the eight remaining workers trapped in the flooded mine.

States have money for freebies but not to pay judges: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court noted that while state governments have funds for announcing election freebies, they often cite financial constraints in paying judges' salaries.
Not a snowball's chance in hell: Trudeau on Trump's US-Canada merger threatUS President-elect Donald Trump threatened to use "economic force" to pressure Canada into becoming the 51st US state.

What's the real story of tourism in Goa right now?Is tourism in Goa really declining, or are we missing an undercurrent, a positive one that can reposition the state's identity as the "party capital of India"?

Delhi Chief Minister bungalow row heats up as poll dates announcedAAP accused the BJP of trying to throw Delhi Chief Minister Atishi out of her official residence. The BJP, while denying the claims, accused Atishi of never moving into the house to avoid upsetting Arvind Kejriwal.

I won't bite: Kamala Harris after senator's husband refuses to shake handsAs the Republican Senator refused to shake the outgoing US Vice President's hand, Kamala Harris replied, "It's OK, I won't bite. I'm not going to bite, don't worry."

Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah in Sydney Test: It was my faultSam Konstas admitted it was his mistake to provoke Jasprit Bumrah in the Sydney Test, as he believed his batting partner, Usman Khawaja, needed extra time before facing the next delivery in the final over of Day 1.

Anupam Kher on Emergency: We should treat this film above all the controversiesVeteran actor Anupam Kher shared his experience of playing late politician Jayaprakash Narayan in the upcoming film Emergency. The actor said that the film should be treated 'above all the controversies.'

OnePlus 13 launched in India: Prices, full specifications, sale details and moreOnePlus has launched its latest flagship, the OnePlus 13, in India with a starting price of Rs 69,999. The phone, which will go on sale via Amazon, brings several upgrades.

Mark Zuckerberg dumps fact-checkers on Meta, Trump pleased, Elon Musk approvesMeta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the overhauling of Facebook's censorship policies, removing fact-checkers, and adopting a community-driven moderation system inspired by Elon Musk's X.

Taarak Mehta actor Gurucharan Singh hospitalised, says 'condition is very bad' Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Gurucharan Singh has been hospitalised. He shared a video from the hospital bed and updated fans about his health.

Little boy's Aaj Ki Raat dance on table at food court gets big love. Viral videoIn the video, the boy performs on a table, seemingly at a food court, effortlessly recreating the dance steps of Aaj Ki Raat.

VIP culture an aberration, should have no place in society: Jagdeep DhankharAccording to Vice President Dhankar, the political changes that are taking place in India, engineered by the political forces inimical to Indian democracy, are "more dangerous than the climate change".

Massive wildfire rages through Los Angeles hillside, forces 30,000 to evacuateWildfires scorched the Pacific Palisades, forcing 30,000 to flee as flames destroyed homes. Officials braced for worsening winds, threatening more devastation in the upscale Los Angeles neighbourhood.

Thick fog engulfs Delhi, 37 flights delayed, temperature likely to dip furtherA thick fog disrupted flight services across North India, delaying dozens of flights and at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport.

Papa ki copy: Fans react to SRK-Aryan Khan's striking similarity in new photoshootShah Rukh Khan's photoshoot with son Aryan Khan for his clothing brand has fans demanding a father-son film collaboration. Aryan gears up for his Netflix directorial debut, tentatively titled Stardom, this year.

X suspends UK journalist after she investigates Elon Musk fan account A journalist claimed that her X account was suspended, and an article by her was blocked on the platform after she wrote a piece about online theories suggesting that an X account was secretly run by Elon Musk himself.

Soldier who exploded Tesla outside Trump hotel used ChatGPT, generative AI: CopsA decorated soldier's Cybertruck explosion outside Trump's hotel highlights generative AI concerns, personal trauma, and political grievances.
Isro to get new chief: Dr V Narayanan to take over from S Somnath on Jan 14Distinguished Scientist at Isro, Dr V Narayanan is currently the Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).

Can Nikola Tesla's idea of free, limitless energy be turned into reality today?On Nikola Tesla's death anniversary, we are diving into his visionary free energy idea conceptualised by the Wardenclyffe Tower, and examining whether the 'mad' genius' idea is feasible with today's technology.

Actor Ajith Kumar to resume practice today after narrow escape in race car crashActor Ajith Kumar will resume his practice session today in Dubai. On January 7, he had a narrow escape after his race car crashed during one of the sessions.

South Korea court re-issues arrest warrant against impeached President Yoon A South Korean court reissued an arrest warrant for impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol over insurrection allegations. Investigators, blocked by presidential guards last week, vowed to proceed. Yoon's injunction request to nullify the warrant was rejected.

Video: Bulldozers clear abandoned cars amid Los Angeles wildfire evacuations Nearly 30,000 residents in Los Angeles' Pacific Palisades, an upscale locality, were evacuated as a massive wildfire destroyed acres and homes.

Papa ki copy: Fans react to SRK-Aryan Khan's striking similarity in new photoshootShah Rukh Khan's photoshoot with son Aryan Khan for his clothing brand has fans demanding a father-son film collaboration. Aryan gears up for his Netflix directorial debut, tentatively titled Stardom, this year.

Manoj Muntashir warns Sky Force makers of legal action over song credit disputeLyricist Manoj Muntashir shared his anger on X after Sky Force makers didn't give him credit for writing the upcoming song Maaye. Muntashir threatened the makers with legal action.

Happy Birthday Yash: 5 best films of KGF actor to watch on OTTKannada actor Yash is celebrating his 38th birthday on January 8. On his birthday, let us take a look at his five best films to watch on OTT platforms.

Kiara Advani in talks for Maddock Films' Shakti Shalini? Here's what we knowKiara Advani is rumoured to star in Maddock Films' Shakti Shalini, a project celebrating strong female leads. While talks are ongoing, no confirmation has been made yet.

sports.headline: Two-tier Test cricket system proposal fair? South Africa's Graeme Smith reactsFormer South Africa captain Graeme Smith said teams like South Africa, West Indies and Sri Lanka need to be strong to ensure Test cricket remains competitive. The legendary cricketer expressed concerns about the reportedly proposed idea of a two-tier system for the traditional format.

Arteta blames Carabao Cup ball for Arsenal's 0-2 loss to Newcastle UnitedMikel Arteta believes Arsenal's inability to adjust to the Carabao Cup ball played a role in Tuesday's 2-0 semifinal, first-leg loss against Newcastle United.

Didier Deschamps to step down as France manager after 2026 FIFA World CupFrance head coach Didier Deschamps will step down from the role when his current contract ends after the 2026 World Cup. Deschamps led Les Bleus to the 2018 World Cup title.

Sam Konstas reveals surprise chat with 'legend' Virat Kohli after MCG dramaYoung Australia opener Sam Konstas has revealed his post-match chat with Virat Kohli after the Boxing Day Test drama at the MCG. Konstas told Kohli that he idolises the Indian batting great.

Neymar says 2026 World Cup will be his last; hints at reunion with Messi, SuarezBrazilian forward Neymar has expressed interest in reuniting with his former Barcelona teammates Lionel Messi and Luis Suarez at Inter Miami. The 32-year-old also revealed that the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be his final opportunity to chase the dream of World Cup glory.

Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah in Sydney Test: It was my faultSam Konstas admitted it was his mistake to provoke Jasprit Bumrah in the Sydney Test, as he believed his batting partner, Usman Khawaja, needed extra time before facing the next delivery in the final over of Day 1.

Fresh injury casts doubt over Nick Kyrgios's Australian Open return Nick Kyrgios has cast fresh uncertainty over his participation in the Australian Open after pulling out of an exhibition match with Novak Djokovic.

Elon Musk 'would like to' buy Premier League club Liverpool, claims fatherElon Musk's father, Errol, said his billionaire son has expressed interest in buying English Premier League club Liverpool. The Premier League club is privately owned by Fenway Sports Group.

Hockey India League: Kalinga Lancers thrash Bengal Tigers to claim 1st winKalinga Lancers produced a stunning performance to thrash Shrachi Rarh Bengal Tigers 6-0 to register their first win of the Hockey India League 2024-25. Thierry Brinkman was the star of the show for the Lancers in Rourkela.

After Ireland ODI snub, Shafali bangs on India selection doors with 91, 95Shafali Verma has chipped in with useful knocks of 91 and 95 for Team A in the Senior Women's One-Day Challenger Trophy. Earlier, Shafali missed out on a berth in the Indian team for the ODI series against Ireland.

Malaysia Open: Lakshya Sen suffers shock first round exit, loses to Chi Yu-jenAn inconsistent performance from Lakshya Sen saw the Indian shuttler suffer a shock exit from the Malaysia Open on Tuesday, January 7. Lakshya had unforced errors creep into his game on Tuesday.

Virat Kohli's antics during BGT slammed by Sunil Gavaskar: Simply not cricketSunil Gavaskar has slammed Virat Kohli's on-field antics during the recently-concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Gavaskar feels that Kohli put his teammates under pressure with his actions during the series against Australia.

England captain Ben Stokes calls himself 'bionic man' after hamstring surgeryEngland Test captain Ben Stokes hilariously called himself a 'bionic man' after undergoing surgery to fix his hamstring injury. Stokes sustained the injury while bowling during the New Zealand Test series.

Salah, Trent, Van Dijk performances not affected by contract talk: Arne SlotLiverpool boss Arne Slot has suggested that Mohamed Salah, Trent Alexander-Arnold and Virgil van Dijk are not being affected by the talk about their contract situation at the club. The trio's current deals are all set to expire in the summer of this year.

Neeraj Chopra doesn't need Jan Zelezny 365 days a year: SumariwallaOutgoing AFI President Adille Sumariwalla said that Indian javelin star Neeraj Chopra does not require coach Jan Zelezny for 365 days a year. Last year, Zelezny, a three-time Olympic champion, joined Chopra as his coach.

Leaky roof halts HS Prannoy's match, Viktor Axelsen out in 1st roundMalaysia Open 2024: A leaky roof affected quite a few matches on Day 1 of the Super 1000 tournament. HS Prannoy's first-round match was pushed to Wednesday. Meanwhile, defending Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen was stunned in the first round in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.

Kohli, Rohit should play domestic cricket and see how it is: Ravi ShastriRavi Shastri has strongly endorsed a return to domestic cricket for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma after their horrendous run of form during the recently-concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Kohli and Rohit struggled to make an impact as India lost the series to the Aussies.

Smriti Mandhana nominated for Player of the Month award in December India's Smriti Mandhana, Australia's Annabel Sutherland and South Africa's Nonkululeko Mlaba are the nominees for the ICC Women's Player of the Month award for December.

HS Prannoy's first-round match was pushed to Wednesday. Meanwhile, defending Olympic champion Viktor Axelsen was stunned in the first round in Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday.

Kohli and Rohit struggled to make an impact as India lost the series to the Aussies.

Smriti Mandhana nominated for Player of the Month award in December India's Smriti Mandhana, Australia's Annabel Sutherland and South Africa's Nonkululeko Mlaba are the nominees for the ICC Women's Player of the Month award for December.

Hope the perfect storm in Australia doesn't define Virat Kohli: Deep DasguptaAustralia vs India: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, Deep Dasgupta said Virat Kohli was caught in a perfect storm during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. Dasgupta expressed confidence that Kohli can bounce back from his struggles, provided he retains the hunger to address his shortcomings.

Williamson, Smith unlikely to play Pakistan Super LeagueSteve Smith and Kane Williamson are unlikely to take part in the 2025 Pakistan Super League scheduled to take place in April-May. The PCB are also waiting for clearance from the ECB for England cricketers' participation in the tournament.

Why John Cena should win the WWE Royal Rumble 2025John Cena has started his farewell tour on WWE RAW's NetFlix debut and made his intentions clear of winning the Royal Rumble and headlining WrestleMania. We take a look at why WWE should pull the trigger on this scenario and allow Cena to win the Rumble match.

Sarfaraz Khan was completely dumped, don't think it was right: Sanjay ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar has expressed his displeasure at Sarfaraz Khan being completely 'dumped' from the Indian team for KL Rahul during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Sarfaraz didn't get a chance to play any matches during the series against Australia.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
